gurmukhi: hws khw ieh audws smY giH Aws rho pr mY n rhoNgI ]249]
transliteration: Haas Kahaa Eh Udaas Samai Grih Aas Raho Par Main A Rahon-gee||249||
translation: “Do not joke with me at this sad hour, I shall have hope and return to our home if I shall be with you, but I shall not live here without you.”249.
Speech of ram addressed to Sita :

gurmukhi: rws kho quih bws kro giH swsu kI syv BlI ibiD kIjY ]
transliteration: Raas Kaho Tuh(i) Baas Daro Grih Saas(u) Kisev Bhalibidh(i) Keejai||
translation: “O Sita ! I am telling you the truth that you will be able to serve your mother-inlaw nicely while living in your home.

gurmukhi: kwl hI bws bnY miRg locin rwj kroN qum so sun lIjY ]
transliteration: Kaal Hibaas Banai Mrig Lochanndi) Raaj Daron Toum So Soun Leejai||
translation: “O doe-eyed ! The time will pass away quickly, I shall rule alongwith you.

gurmukhi: jO n lgY jIX AauD suBwnin jwih ipqw giH swc BnIjY ]
transliteration: Jau Na Lagad Jeeya Audh Soubhaanan(i) Jaah(i) Pitaa Grih Saach Bhaneejai||
translation: “If indeed, your mind does does not feel at home in Oudh, O winsome-faced ! You go to your father’s house.

gurmukhi: qwq kI bwq gfI jIX jwq isDwq bnY muih Awies dIjY ]250]
transliteration: Taat Kibaat Gadijeeya Jaat Sidhaat Banai Muh(i) Aais Deejai||250||
translation: “In my mind the instruction of my father abides, therefore you permit me to go to go to the forest.”250.

gurmukhi: bwq ieqY iehu BwNq BeI sun Awiegy BRwq srwsn lIny ] kaun kupUq BXo kul my ijn rwmih bws bnY khu dIny ]
transliteration: Baat Itai Eh(i) Bhaant Bhaisoun Aaege Bhraat Saraason Leene|| Kaoun Koupoot Bhayo Kul Me Jin Raamah(i) Baas Banai Kauh Deene||
translation: This talk was going on when hearing it, Lakshman came with his bow in his hand and said, “Who can be that undutiful son in our clan who has asked for exile of Ram?

gurmukhi: kwm ky bwn biDXo bs kwmn kUr kucwl mhw miq hIny ] rwNf kuBwNf ky hwQ ibikXo kip nwcq nwc CrI ijm cIny ]251]
transliteration: Kaam Ke Baan Badhio Bas Kaamanndkoor Kudhaal Mahaa Mat(i) Heene|| Raand Koubhaand Ke Haath Bikiyo Kap(i) Naachat Naach Chharijim Cheene||251||
translation: “This foolish person (king) pierced by the arrows of the god of love, entrapped in cruel misconduct, under the impact of a foolish woman is dancing like a monkey understanding the sign of a stick.251.

gurmukhi: kwm ko fMf lIey kr kykeI bwnr ijau niRp nwc ncwvY ] AYTn AYT AmYT lIey iFg bYT sUAw ijm pwT pVwvY ]
transliteration: Kaam Ko Dand Leee Kar Kekaibaanar Jio Nrip Naach Nachaavai|| Aithan Aith Amaith Leee Dhig Baith Sooaa Jim Paath Padaavai||
translation: “Taking the stick of lust in her hand Kaikeyi is causing the king to dance like a monkey; that proud woman has caught hold of the king and sitting with him she is teaching him lessons like a parrot.

gurmukhi: sauqn sIs hÍY eIsk eIs piRQIs ijau cwm ky dwm clwvY ] kUr kujwq kupMQ durwnn log gey prlok gvwvY ]252]
transliteration: Saoutan Sees Hvai Eesak Ees Prithees Jio Chaam Ke Daam Chalaavai|| Koor Kujaat Koupanth Duraanan Log Gad Parlok Gadaavai||252||
translation: “This woman is riding over the heads of her co-wives like a god of hods and for a short while is making current the coins of leather like the king (i.e. she is behaving to her liking). This cruel, inferior, ill-disciplined and ill-mouthed woman has not on

gurmukhi: log kutyv lgy aun kI pRB pwv qjy muih kXo bn AYhY ] jau ht bYT rho Gir mo js kXo cilhY rGubMs ljYhY ]
transliteration: Log Koutev Lage Oun Kiprabh Paav Taje Muh(i) Kyo Ban Aihai|| Jau Hat Baith Raho Ghar(i) Mo Jas Kyo Chalihai Raghoubans Lajaihai||
translation: “The people have begun to talk ill of both the king and the queen, how can I live by forsaking the feet of Ram, therefore I shall also go to the forests;

gurmukhi: kwl hI kwl aucwrq kwl gXo ieh kwl sBo Cl jYhY ] Dwm rho nhI swc khoN ieh Gwq geI iPr hwQ n AYhY ]253]
transliteration: Kaal Hikaal Ouchaarat Kaal Gado Eh Kaal Sabho Chhal Jaihai|| Dhaam Raho Nahisaach Kahon Eh Ghaat Gadphir Haath Na Aihaee||253||
translation: “The whole time has passed in seeking an opportunity to serve ram and in this way the time will deceive all. I am telling the truth that I shall not stay at home and if this opportunity of service is lost, then I cannot avail it.”253.

gurmukhi: cwNp DrY kr cwr ku qIr qunIr ksy doaU bIr suhwey ] AwvD rwj qRIXw ijh soBq hon ibdw iqh qIr isDwey ]
transliteration: Chaanp Ddarai Kar Chaar Ku Teer Touneer Kase Dooo Beer Suhaae|| Aavadh Raaj Treeyaa Jih Sobhat Hon Bidaa Tih Teer Sidhaae||
translation: Holding the bow in one hand and tightening the quiver and holding three-four arrows in the other hand both the brothers are looking impressive; the side on which the
